clues.ACERBATE: cause to be bitter or resentful
clues.ACNE: an inflammatory disease involving the sebaceous glands of the skin; characterized by papules or pustules or comedones
clues.AGING: begin to seem older; get older
clues.AGIO: a fee charged for exchanging currencies
clues.AGON: a festivity in ancient Greece at which competitors contended for prizes
clues.AGRA: a city in northern India; former capital of the Mogul empire; site of the Taj Mahal
clues.ALE: a general name for beer made with a top fermenting yeast; in some of the United States an ___ is (by law) a brew of more than 4% alcohol by volume
clues.ALLELE: (genetics) either of a pair (or series) of alternative forms of a gene that can occupy the same locus on a particular chromosome and that control the same character
clues.ARCA: type genus of the family Arcidae: ark shells and blood clams
clues.ARTS: studies intended to provide general knowledge and intellectual skills (rather than occupational or professional skills)
clues.ASIA: the largest continent with 60% of the earth's population; it is joined to Europe on the west to form Eurasia; it is the site of some of the world's earliest civilizations
clues.ATTEST: authenticate, affirm to be true, genuine, or correct, as in an official capacity
clues.BEND: curved segment (of a road or river or railroad track etc.)
clues.BIB: a napkin tied under the chin of a child while eating
clues.BOO: a cry or noise made to express displeasure or contempt
clues.BPH: enlarged prostate; appears to be part of the natural aging process
clues.CPR: an emergency procedure consisting of external cardiac massage and artificial respiration; the first treatment for a person who has collapsed and has no pulse and has stopped breathing; attempts to restore circulation of the blood and prevent death or brain damage due to lack of oxygen
clues.CREE: the Algonquian language spoken by the ____
clues.DARKEY: (ethnic slur) offensive term for Black people
clues.ENOL: an organic compound that contains a hydroxyl group bonded to a carbon atom which in turn is doubly bonded to another carbon atom
clues.ERINGO: any plant of the genus Eryngium
clues.FAE: a device consisting of a container of fuel and two explosive charges; the first charge bursts open the fuel container at a predetermined height and spreads the fuel in a cloud that mixes with atmospheric oxygen; the second charge detonates the cloud which creates an enormous blast wave and incinerates whatever is below
clues.FRESS: eat a lot and without restraint
clues.GAOL: a correctional institution used to detain persons who are in the lawful custody of the government (either accused persons awaiting trial or convicted persons serving a sentence)
clues.GOLDENROD: any of numerous chiefly summer-blooming and fall-blooming North American plants especially of the genus Solidago
clues.GOY: a Christian as contrasted with a Jew
clues.INITIATE: people who have been introduced to the mysteries of some field or activity
clues.INR: an agency that is the primary source in the State Department for interpretive analyses of global developments and focal point for policy issues and activities of the Intelligence Community
clues.INTER: place in a grave or tomb
clues.IOU: an informal debt instrument; representing `I owe you'
clues.IRAN: a theocratic Islamic republic in the Middle East in western Asia; ____ was the core of the ancient empire that was known as Persia until 1935; rich in oil
clues.LEES: United States filmmaker whose works explore the richness of black culture in America (born in 1957)
clues.MACE: an official who carries a mace of office
clues.MALL: a public area set aside as a pedestrian walk
clues.MARE: a dark region of considerable extent on the surface of the moon
clues.MEG: the number that is represented as a one followed by 6 zeros
clues.NEED: the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior
clues.NOC: an undercover agent who is given no official cover
clues.OMEN: a sign of something about to happen
clues.PAIL: a roughly cylindrical vessel that is open at the top
clues.PAMPERER: someone who pampers or spoils by excessive indulgence
clues.PEAT: partially carbonized vegetable matter saturated with water; can be used as a fuel when dried
clues.PET: a fit of ___ulance or sulkiness (especially at what is felt to be a slight)
clues.PMS: a syndrome that occurs in many women from 2 to 14 days before the onset of menstruation
clues.PODETIUM: an organ or body resembling a stalk; especially the outgrowth of the thallus of certain lichens on which the ascocarp is borne
clues.PRECINCT: a district of a city or town marked out for administrative purposes
clues.RAGI: East Indian cereal grass whose seed yield a somewhat bitter flour, a staple in the Orient
clues.RAT: desert one's party or group of friends, for example, for one's personal advantage
clues.RAVE: a dance party that lasts all night and electronically synthesized music is played
clues.REB: `Johnny' was applied as a nickname for Confederate soldiers by the Federal soldiers in the American Civil War; `greyback' derived from their grey Confederate uniforms
clues.SAM: a guided missile fired from land or shipboard against an airborne target
clues.SETOSE: having or covered with protective barbs or quills or spines or thorns or setae etc.
clues.SHUN: avoid and stay away from deliberately; stay clear of
clues.SILT: mud or clay or small rocks deposited by a river or lake
clues.SIMON: United States playwright noted for light comedies (born in 1927)
clues.SLS: a caustic detergent useful for removing grease; although commonly included in personal care items (shampoos and toothpastes etc.) it can irritate skin and should not be swallowed
clues.SMOKER: a party for men only (or one considered suitable for men only)
clues.STAY: a thin strip of metal or bone that is used to stiffen a garment (e.g. a corset)
clues.TAAL: an official language of the Republic of South Africa; closely related to Dutch and Flemish
clues.TAMP: a tool for ____ing (e.g., for ____ing tobacco into a pipe bowl or a charge into a drill hole etc.)
clues.TIB: a unit of information equal to 1024 gibibytes or 2^40 (1,099,511,627,776) bytes
clues.TIE: (music) a slur over two notes of the same pitch; indicates that the note is to be sustained for their combined time value
clues.TSA: an agency established in 2001 to safeguard United States transportation systems and insure safe air travel
clues.WYE: the 25th letter of the Roman alphabet
